channel.title: Morning Shift
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Shift examines the latest news in employment, labor and immigration politics and policy.

item.title: Trump's AI executive order muddles picture for employers
item.description: The Trump administration’s standoff with states over artificial intelligence may leave employers caught in the middle.
item.dc:creator: By Nick Niedzwiadek

item.title: State Department rattles higher ed with new visa policy
item.description: The Trump administration’s recent attempts to overhaul visa programs are rankling higher education groups who fear plans for increased vetting are unclear and risk pushing away top talent.
item.dc:creator: By Lawrence Ukenye

item.title: Lawmakers dig in to protect miners
item.description: Bipartisan concern is brewing on Capitol Hill after the Labor Department signaled that it may reconsider a Biden-era rule aimed at protecting miners from toxic silica dust.
item.dc:creator: By Lawrence Ukenye

item.title: Holiday hiring bump endures despite soft labor market
item.description: While this past weekend kicked off the holiday season, retail chains, the service sector and other employers have spent weeks staffing up to meet the crush of consumer demand.
item.dc:creator: By Nick Niedzwiadek

item.title: Unions back amendment to shield Pentagon employees
item.description: Federal-sector unions are supporting an effort to secure bargaining rights for Pentagon employees as lawmakers finalize last-minute amendments to the military's must-pass legislation.
item.dc:creator: By Lawrence Ukenye

item.title: The shutdown's over, but the NLRB is still in a bind
item.description: The end of the record-setting government shutdown has set the stage for a renewed focus on the controversies surrounding the federal agency charged with protecting the rights of private sector workers.
item.dc:creator: By Nick Niedzwiadek

item.title: Republicans take a big swing on labor reform
item.description: Senate HELP Committee Republicans unveiled a slate of bills aimed at raising the bar for filing grievances with the National Labor Relations Board.
item.dc:creator: By Lawrence Ukenye
